en.text: Speaker twist CHECK NOTES concering Speakon - IMPORTANT
en.comment: When not to use "Speakon" & "Powercon" - Both these terms are registered trademarks and are only allowed to be used by the inventors of those type of plugs : Neutrik. When translating connectors  from a direct competitor of Neutrik (​one of several and a very important one is Amphenol​ !)  that is making/selling compatible plugs of the same design to Speakon, you must never use the terms  "Speakon" or "Powercon". In these cases, instead of Speakon, use  „Speaker Twist“, and instead of Powercon, use "Power Twist“. These are also the generic terms in the respective wikis/used online.

en.text: Power twist CHECK NOTES concering Powercon - IMPORTANT
en.comment: Both these terms are registered trademarks and are only allowed to be used by the inventors of those type of plugs : Neutrik. When translating connectors  from a direct competitor of Neutrik (​one of several and a very important one is Amphenol​ !)  that is making/selling compatible plugs of the same design to Speakon, you must never use the terms  "Speakon" or "Powercon". In these cases, instead of Speakon, use  „Speaker Twist“, and instead of Powercon, use "Power Twist“. These are also the generic terms in the respective wikis/used online.

What's the difference? Frequency Range is the actual span of frequencies that a monitor can reproduce, say from 30 Hz (Bass) to 22 kHz (Treble). Frequency Response is the Frequency Range versus Amplitude. In other words, at 20 Hz, a certain input signal level may produce 100 dB of output.

en.comment:
These seem to be note the same thing though I have the feeling that the terms are sometimes interchanged.

The main difference seems to be that a flat cable is a form of a ribbon cable, but a miniature version https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flexible_flat_cable
